intro: Triumfetta oblongata, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often oval or oblong in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
